description: On the 25th of March 2020, Jordan’s Prime Minister announces that “people would be allowed to leave their homes from 10am to 18:00pm to walk to corner shops, groceries, bakeries and pharmacies.”
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 21, 2020, the national government of Jordan announced that "under amended curfew hours for the Holy month of Ramadan, people may move on foot from 8 am to 6 pm" starting April 25 unless otherwise announced.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
On April 27, 2020, the national government of Jordan announced the easing of the coronavirus curfew allowing residents of the capital to drive their private vehicles between 8:00 am and 6:00 pm. 

 UPDATE: The original curfew only targeted people moving by foot, but the update targeted people with private vehicles.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: With Jordan's Independence Day events occurring on the 25th of May 2020, the national government imposed an overnight curfew restriction from 19:00-8:00.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Jordan's national government announces that the Ramtha district will have a curfew from 8:00 pm till 6:00 am starting August 17, 2020 due to the increasing numbers of coronavirus cases.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: On August 24, 2020, Jordan's national government announces that starting August 25, daily evening curfews from 11 pm to 6 am will be imposed on individuals.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On August 25, 2020, the Government of Jordan imposed a curfew from 8 pm till 6 am for the city of Sahab "until the epidemiological situation in the city stabilizes".
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: The curfew imposed on Ramtha from 8:00 pm till 6:00 am will be lifted on August 25, 2020. UPDATE: The curfew imposed on Ramtha city from 8:00 pm till 6:00 am will be lifted on August 25, 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: On August 26, 2020, the Jordanian government announced that it will impose a comprehensive curfew in Amman and Zarqa from Thursday, August 27 at 11:00 p.m. through Saturday, August 29 at 6:00 a.m. UPDATE: The original policy was a curfew which started from August 25, 2020. On August 26, 2020, the Jordanian government announced that it will impose a comprehensive curfew in Amman and Zarqa from Thursday, August 27 at 11:00 p.m. through Saturday, August 29 at 6:00 a.m.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On September 9, 2020, the national government of Jordan implements a nightly curfew for individuals from 1 am till 6 am.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 17th of March 2020, Jordan’s national government declares a state of emergency to curb the coronavirus pandemic targeting all residents including citizen residents and foreign residents.
Jordan stops all inbound and outbound flights starting Tuesday, March 17th until further notice. It also closed its ports of entry through land or water.
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Jordan facilitates the return of students studying abroad amid coronavirus pandemic. Priority will be given to female students, graduates, freshmen, and “people who were on a short visit abroad.” UPDATE: Jordan closed its borders completely, but will now be offering repatriation flights to Jordanian students studying abroad.
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Jordan authorizes the use of hydroxychloroquine along with an antiviral medicine as a treatment for COVID-19 in patients in an advanced stage of the disease.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Jordanian authorities closed off Irbid city from the rest of Jordan. The government decided to ban entry and exit from the city, except for authorized persons.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: Beginning Saturday, March 21, 2020 at 7 am, Jordan’s national government imposes a three-day curfew “aimed at containing the new coronavirus”.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Jordanian authorities have placed Irbid city under complete lockdown after it recorded 26 new coronavirus infections. The government decided to lock down the city and isolate its villages from each other to prevent the movement of people within the governorate of Irbid.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: The initial lockdown started on March 21, 2020 and was set to last until March 24, 2020; the extension was announced on March 23, 2020. Thousands of troops were deployed at checkpoints in main cities and four prisons were prepared for any violators. UPDATE: The initial lockdown started on March 21, 2020 and was set to last until March 24, 2020; the extension was announced on March 23, 2020. Thousands of troops were deployed at checkpoints in main cities and four prisons were prepared for any violators.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Jordan imposes a 24-hour lockdown on April 3rd. The lockdown encompasses shops, bakeries, and even pharmacies and left open only hospitals and emergency services.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Jordan's national government announces a 48-hour nationwide lockdown which will begin on Thursday midnight, on the 10th of April 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 12, 2020, the national government announced the extension of lockdown until the end of April "to stem the spread of coronavirus". UPDATE: The original lockdown was set to end on April 13, 2020, but on April 12, the national government announced the extension of lockdown until the end of April "to stem the spread of coronavirus".
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 27, 2020, Jordan eased the lockdown measures on its residents allowing them to drive their private vehicles during a certain time-frame (8 am - 6 pm). UPDATE: The original lockdown was set for 2 days on April 10, 2020. However, on the 12th of April, the national government announced that it would extend the lockdown till the end of April. On April 27, Jordan eased the lockdown measures on its residents.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
The national government imposes a 24-comprehensive curfew for the Amman and Zarqa governates starting
Thursday September 3rd, 2020 at 11pm through Friday September 4th at 11pm. In addition, the daily evening curfew is 
still in effect nationwide.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: The Jordanian government announced a multi-day national lockdown for a full 4 days starting on November 11th, 2020 around noon and ending November 15th, 2020 at 6 a.m.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Jordan evacuates 71 students from Wuhan.
type_text: Evacuation of students back to their home country. This include 55 Jordanians, 7 Palestinians, 3 Omanis, 1 Lebanese, 3 Tunisian, 1 Bahraini, and a student's wive who is Russian.

description: Jordan cuts some clauses of the Social Security Act amid coronavirus chaos. The new order will allow companies to reduce the mandatory commitment of paying 21.75 percent on each staff member to 5.4 percent. This will take place for the months of March, April, and May.
type_text: The policy is a form of economic support. A new order will allow companies to reduce the mandatory commitment of paying 21.75 percent on each staff member to Social Security to 5.4 percent.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Jordan bans serving hookah (shisha) and smoking cigarettes in cafes and restaurants.
type_text: Jordan bans smoking shisha and cigarettes to prevent the spread of the virus.

description: Jordan closes touristic attractions for a week in order to sanitize them.
type_text: The policy is to close down touristic attractions. The aim of policy is sanitize such places and not to stop people from gathering there.

description: Starting March 10, Jordanians coming from countries of Lebanon, Syria, Israel, Iraq, Egypt, France, Spain, and Germany will be allowed to enter the country with the condition of self-quarantine for 14 days.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 16th of March 2020, Jordan’s national government imposes compulsory quarantine on all inbound and outbound travelers and residents; they will be required to adhere for self-quarantine for 14 days.
type_sub_cat: Quarantine outside the home or government facility (i.e. quarantine in a hotel)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On March 30, Jordan's national government starts releasing Jordanians held in mandatory 14-day quarantine. UPDATE: On March 16, Jordan's national government imposed a mandatory 14-day quarantine on all inbound and outbound travelers and residents. On March 30, the government starts releasing Jordanians held in the mandatory quarantine.
type_sub_cat: Quarantine outside the home or government facility (i.e. quarantine in a hotel)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On March 31, the government starts releasing non-Jordanians held in mandatory 14-day quarantine back to their residences. UPDATE: On March 16, Jordan's national government imposes mandatory 14-day quarantine on all inbound and outbound travelers and residents. On March 31, the government starts releasing non-Jordanians.
type_sub_cat: Quarantine outside the home or government facility (i.e. quarantine in a hotel)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On March 30, Jordan's national government imposed a mandatory self-quarantine for 14 days for Jordanians who were released from the compulsory government quarantine. All are required to sign and commit.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 31, 2020, Jordan's national government mandates non Jordanians to a 14-day self-quarantine. All will sign and commit.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Jordan stops all public activities and gatherings and advises citizens not to gather for social occasions, including weddings and funerals.
Jordan stops all sports activities and closes cinema halls, swimming pools, gyms, and youth hubs until further notice.
Jordan stops prayers in all mosques and churches.
Jordan forces cafes and restaurants to maintain distance between seats.
Jordan permits visits to hospitals and prisons.
